dfischer.utils

Class SmtpMessage

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • dfischer.utils.SmtpMessage
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class SmtpMessage
extends java.lang.Thread
    Sends an e-mail by using the SMTP protocol. Supports also authentication against SMTP servers. E-mails can be send either as plain ASCII messages or as HTML formatted messages. HTML formatted messages can contain embedded images. Sending attachments together with a message is supported.
     
    Note: the e-mail is asynchronously transmitted by using an internal thread. This means that the method send() immediately returns. Waiting for e-mail transmission completion is optional and can be done by calling waitForSendCompletion().
     
    Programming Example:
     String htmlMessage = "<body><html><img src="cid:123"><ul><li>first</li><li>second</li></ul><font color="blue">blue sea</font></body></html>";
 
 SmtpMessage smtpMessage = new SmtpMessage(smtpHost);
 smtpMessage.setSmtpAuthentication(authUsername, authPassword);
 smtpMessage.markHtmlMessage();
 smtpMessage.addHtmlImage("C:\\logo\\f_logo.gif", "123");
 smtpMessage.attacheFile(new File("C:\\doc\\manual.pdf"));
 smtpMessage.setDebug();
 smtpMessage.send(from, to, subject, htmlMessage);
                
 System.out.println("--- waiting for completion ---");
 smtpMessage.waitForSendCompletion();
 String[] debugOutput = smtpMessage.getDebugOutput();
 for (int x = 0; x < debugOutput.length; x++)
   System.out.println(debugOutput[x]);

    • Constructor Detail

      • SmtpMessage

        public SmtpMessage(java.lang.String smtpHost)
        Creates a new instance and sets the SMTP server.
        Parameters:
        smtpHost - DNS name or IP address of the SMTP server.

    • Method Detail

      • markHtmlMessage

        public void markHtmlMessage()
        Marks that the e-mail message is in HTML format. If this method is not called the e-mail will be send in plain ASCII text format.

      • addHtmlImage

        public void addHtmlImage(java.lang.String imageFile,
                java.lang.String contentId)
        Adds an embedded image to a HTML message. This method can be called several times which allows to add multiple images.
        Parameters:
        imageFile - file name of image (local disk path)
        contentId - arbitrary ID of image. Note: the ID must be referenced as cid in the HTML message.
        HTML Example (contentId = 123): <img src="cid:123">
        See Also:
        markHtmlMessage()

      • addHtmlImage

        public void addHtmlImage(byte[] imageData,
                java.lang.String imageContentType,
                java.lang.String imageName,
                java.lang.String contentId)
        Adds an embedded image to a HTML message. This method can be called several times which allows to add multiple images.
        Parameters:
        imageData - data of the image
        imageContentType - MIME type of the image, for example "image/gif"
        imageName - arbitrary name of the image, for example x.gif
        contentId - arbitrary ID of the image. Note: the ID must be referenced as cid in the HTML message.
        HTML Example (contentId = 123): <img src="cid:123">
        See Also:
        markHtmlMessage()

      • addHtmlImage

        public void addHtmlImage(AlertConfigGenericNotificationEmbeddedHtmlImage htmlImage)
        Adds an embedded image to a HTML message. This method can be called several times which allows to add multiple images.
        Parameters:
        htmlImage - the embedded image to be added
        See Also:
        markHtmlMessage()

      • setSmtpAuthentication

        public void setSmtpAuthentication(java.lang.String authUsername,
                         java.lang.String authPassword)
        Marks that SMTP authentication against the SMTP server must be done.
        Parameters:
        authUsername - username
        authPassword - password

      • setConnectionTimeout

        public void setConnectionTimeout(int seconds)
        Sets the socket connect timeout, used when establishing the TCP/IP connection to the SMTP server. The default value is 30 seconds if this method is never called.
        Parameters:
        seconds - socket connect timeout in seconds

      • setIOTimeout

        public void setIOTimeout(int seconds)
        Sets the transmit and the receive IO timeout for SMTP protocol messages. The default value is 300 seconds (5 minutes) if this method is never called.
        Parameters:
        seconds - transmit and receive timeout for SMTP protocol messages in seconds

      • attacheFile

        public void attacheFile(java.io.File f)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Attaches a file to the e-mail. The MIME type (content type) of the file data is automatically determined by this method. However, if the MIME type cannot be determined, a RuntimeException is thrown. This method can be called several times which allows to attach multiple files.
        Parameters:
        f - file to be attached (must point to local disk path)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • attacheFile

        public void attacheFile(java.io.File f,
               java.lang.String mimeType)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Attaches a file to the e-mail. This method can be called several times which allows to attach multiple files.
        Parameters:
        f - file to be attached (must point to local disk path)
        mimeType - MIME type (content type) of the file data. Example: "application/pdf"
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • attachFileData

        public void attachFileData(java.lang.String virtualFileName,
                  byte[] fileData,
                  java.lang.String mimeType)
        Attaches a (virtual) file to the e-mail. This method can be called several times which allows to attach multiple (virtual) files.
        Parameters:
        virtualFileName - virtual file name, shown to the recipient ot the e-mail
        fileData - data of attached file
        mimeType - MIME type (content type) of the file data. Example: "application/pdf"

      • setDebug

        public void setDebug()
        Marks that debug data are collected during the SMTP transmission. The debug data can be accessed later by calling getDebugOutput() - after the transmission has been completed.
        See Also:
        getDebugOutput()

      • addRecipient

        public void addRecipient(java.lang.String emailAddress,
                int recipientType)
        Adds additional recipients. This method can be called several times before send(..) is called.
        Parameters:
        emailAddress - the email address of the recipient.
        recipientType - the type of the recipient. Possible values are RECIPIENT_TYPE_TO, RECIPIENT_TYPE_CC, RECIPIENT_TYPE_BCC.
        See Also:
        send(String from, String to, String subject, String messageText), RECIPIENT_TYPE_TO, RECIPIENT_TYPE_CC, RECIPIENT_TYPE_BCC

      • send

        public void send(java.lang.String from,
        java.lang.String subject,
        java.lang.String messageText)
        Triggers the internal thread to transmit the e-mail. Note: all e-mail configuration data must be set in advance before this concluding transmission method is called.
        Parameters:
        from - e-mail address of the sender
        subject - subject of e-mail
        messageText - e-mail message (plain ASCII text or HTML formatted text)
        See Also:
        addRecipient(String emailAddress, int recipientType)

      • send

        public void send(java.lang.String from,
        java.lang.String to,
        java.lang.String subject,
        java.lang.String messageText)
        Triggers the internal thread to transmit the e-mail. Note: all e-mail configuration data must be set in advance before this concluding transmission method is called.
        Parameters:
        from - e-mail address of the sender
        to - e-mail address of the recipient
        subject - subject of e-mail
        messageText - e-mail message (plain ASCII text or HTML formatted text)
        See Also:
        addRecipient(String emailAddress, int recipientType)

      • run

        public void run()
        Internal thread, called from send(). Note: do not call this method directly.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class java.lang.Thread
        See Also:
        send(String from, String to, String subject, String messageText)

      • waitForSendCompletion

        public void waitForSendCompletion()
        Optional - wait until SMTP transmission has been completed.

      • waitForSendCompletion

        public boolean waitForSendCompletion(int maxWaitSeconds)
        Optional - wait until SMTP transmission has been completed or until a maximum wait time has been exceeded.
        Parameters:
        maxWaitSeconds - maximum wait time in seconds.
        Returns:
        true if the SMTP transmission has been completed, else false

      • isSendCompleted

        public boolean isSendCompleted()
        Optional - Allows to check if the SMTP transmission has already been completed.
        Returns:
        true if the SMTP transmission has been completed, else false
        See Also:
        waitForSendCompletion(), waitForSendCompletion(int maxWaitSeconds)

      • isSendSuccessful

        public boolean isSendSuccessful()
        Optional - Allows to check if the SMTP transmission was successful. Important Note: you must call one of the methods waitForSendCompletion() in advance before calling this method. If you call this method during a SMTP transmission a RuntimeException is thrown.
        See Also:
        waitForSendCompletion(), waitForSendCompletion(int maxWaitSeconds)

      • getErrorException

        public java.lang.Exception getErrorException()
        Optional - Returns the Exception if the SMTP transmission has failed. Important Note: you must call one of the methods waitForSendCompletion() in advance before calling this method. If you call this method during a SMTP transmission a RuntimeException is thrown.
        Returns:
        the Exception if the SMTP transmission has failed, or null if the SMTP transmission was successful.
        See Also:
        waitForSendCompletion(), waitForSendCompletion(int maxWaitSeconds)

      • getDebugOutput

        public java.lang.String[] getDebugOutput()
        Optional - Returns the debug output of the SMTP transmission. Important Note: you must call one of the methods waitForSendCompletion() in advance before calling this method.
        Returns:
        the debug output of the SMTP transmission, or null if no debug output is available.
        See Also:
        setDebug(), waitForSendCompletion(), waitForSendCompletion(int maxWaitSeconds)

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Interactive test program which allows to send a simple ASCII e-mail and supports SMTP authentication. The input data are asked from the command prompt.
